title: P0rny
author: P0rny
content: Hey!I have the 1btc casascius coin, unpeeled, was wondering what are the prices I can expect if I sell the coin?Been out of the game for over 18months, just checking up. Can provide pictures. Thanks in advance

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: August 30, 2022, 06:12:21 PMLast edit: August 30, 2022, 06:42:34 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES

comments.author: markinaz
comments.body: I would also say it really depends where you sell it as well...  Are you offering directly to this forum?  Or looking for other venue?

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: 3 things will be need:1) What year is your coin from (if 2011 is it s1 or s2)2) probably the most important...is it silver or brass.  If silver is it silver/gilt?3) clear pics of the front and back.  Without these 3 things no one will be able to accurately give ypu an estimate.

comments.author: P0rny
comments.body: Quote from: wheelz1200 on August 30, 2022, 08:10:20 PM3 things will be need:1) What year is your coin from (if 2011 is it s1 or s2)2) probably the most important...is it silver or brass.  If silver is it silver/gilt?3) clear pics of the front and back.  Without these 3 things no one will be able to accurately give ypu an estimate.1) Not sure.2) Brass.3) Just took the front side with the code, can take the back when I'm back home if it's important.

comments.author: P0rny
comments.body: Quote from: Markzellers on August 30, 2022, 07:42:07 PMI would also say it really depends where you sell it as well...  Are you offering directly to this forum?  Or looking for other venue?I'm really looking for options. I was hoping to save it for a few more years but... life has other plans.

comments.author: P0rny
comments.body: Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on August 30, 2022, 06:12:21 PMDepends on what you have? If I were to guess: one BTC in the most common form

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: P0rny on August 30, 2022, 01:08:20 PMHey!I have the 1btc casascius coin, unpeeled, was wondering what are the prices I can expect if I sell the coin?Been out of the game for over 18months, just checking up. Can provide pictures. Thanks in advance Appears to be a 2013 brass 1 btc from your picturesRight now going rate would be about 1.05 area

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: How do you not know what year it’s from? I’d think if it’s in your possession you’d be able to tell by looking at the other side. That’s a bit of a red flag for me unless I’m misunderstanding something. If you do have it, I would definitely ask for more than 1.05 BTC for it.

comments.author: P0rny
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on August 31, 2022, 04:43:01 AMHow do you not know what year it’s from? I’d think if it’s in your possession you’d be able to tell by looking at the other side. That’s a bit of a red flag for me unless I’m misunderstanding something.I bought it a few years ago and just dumped it in a safe place. Yes, I have it with me and can provide pictures of any angle you want including the back - I wrote my username in the pics...Quote from: OgNasty on August 31, 2022, 04:43:01 AM If you do have it, I would definitely ask for more than 1.05 BTC for it.  Thank you, I'm curious as to what I can expect if I properly put it out there.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: @P0rny please add also a date in the picture and not only your username since this is a measure to avoid scammers to recycle your photo and meanwhile it guarantee you have the coin at exact date  .Quote from: P0rny on August 31, 2022, 09:38:08 AM...Quote from: OgNasty on August 31, 2022, 04:43:01 AM If you do have it, I would definitely ask for more than 1.05 BTC for it.  Thank you, I'm curious as to what I can expect if I properly put it out there.My 2 satoshis... place in auction here on forum ( of course accepting escrow service from reputable member  )

comments.author: P0rny
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on August 31, 2022, 11:47:16 AM@P0rny please add also a date in the picture and not only your username since this is a measure to avoid scammers to recycle your photo and meanwhile it guarantee you have the coin at exact date  .Quote from: P0rny on August 31, 2022, 09:38:08 AM...Quote from: OgNasty on August 31, 2022, 04:43:01 AM If you do have it, I would definitely ask for more than 1.05 BTC for it.  Thank you, I'm curious as to what I can expect if I properly put it out there.My 2 satoshis... place in auction here on forum ( of course accepting escrow service from reputable member  )Good point, will add date the next time. Thanks!
